Issues.Title: "By default, the DataGrid.ColumnWidth property is set to SizeToHeader", or is it!
Issues.Body:
While not specified in the XAML Code, but shown as SizeToHeader in the Properties Window, it actually behaves like SizeToCells.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/framework/wpf/controls/sizing-options-in-the-datagrid-control

Sorry if this is the wrong repo.
'''
...
```
<DataGrid x:Name="Tables_DataGrid" Grid.Row="3" Grid.RowSpan="1" Margin ="0" RowDetailsVisibilityMode="VisibleWhenSelected" EnableRowVirtualization="True" DataContext="{StaticResource Tables_ViewSource}" ItemsSource="{Binding Source={StaticResource Tables_ViewSource}}" Grid.Column="1" IsTextSearchEnabled="True" TextSearch.TextPath="Hardware_Model" SelectedIndex="30">

...
'''
```

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62744978/82055978-f159ab80-96c9-11ea-89fd-ac9440f1879a.png)

![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62744978/82055951-e737ad00-96c9-11ea-8869-0ddfc6438077.png)
But when a cell with longer text is reached:
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/62744978/82056019-00405e00-96ca-11ea-8884-0e127f5ede43.png)


VS2019
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ""By default, the DataGrid.ColumnWidth property is set to SizeToHeader", or is it! " (#3006)

Issues.Title: Controls in a TabItem get focused  in a strange way
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: all
* Windows version: 16299.1565
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? No

 **Problem description:**
 The  element in a TabItem get focused  in a strange way.

 **Actual behavior:** 
https://ibb.co/r5NkrpN

The first TextBox get focus after click the tab header. If I change the selected TabItem(i.e. click on another tab header), the first TextBox in the selected item focesed. 
At this state, if user double-click the header, no child element get focus. And then you could change the tab item between each other, all works well, no element in TabItem get focus.
 
 **Expected behavior:**
 If user have not click any UI control under TabItem, there should be no control focused.
 **Minimal repro:**
` <Grid> 
        <TabControl>
            <TabItem Header="TabItem#1" FocusManager.FocusedElement="{x:Null}">
                <StackPanel>
                    <TextBox IsReadOnly="True">Tab1</TextBox>
                    <TextBox IsReadOnly="True"> Tab1</TextBox>
                </StackPanel>
            </TabItem>
            <TabItem Header="TabItem#2" FocusManager.FocusedElement="{x:Null}">
                <StackPanel>
                    <TextBox IsReadOnly="True">Tab2 It will get focus just after change the selected Tab Item</TextBox>
                    <TextBox IsReadOnly="True">Tab2</TextBox>
                </StackPanel>
            </TabItem>
        </TabControl>
    </Grid>`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Controls in a TabItem get focused  in a strange way" (#3005)

Issues.Title: Add links in "new issue" flow to other related repos
Issues.Body:
This .yml adds quick links to other repos below the existing issue template buttons in your new issue flow.

For an example of what this looks like, see https://github.com/danmosemsft/runtime/issues/new/choose (the white buttons below your existing green buttons)

We are adding this in dotnet/runtime (https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/pull/36431). Reasoning: it's sometimes confusing which is the correct repo to open an issue in. The goal here is to make it easier to open an issue in the correct repo first time so we need to move fewer issues and they more quickly get attention from the right people.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add links in "new issue" flow to other related repos" (#3001)

Issues.Title: XAML won't render left curly bracket in button content
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.1.202
* Windows version: 10.0.18363
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? Yes, filed a [bug report](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/1015032/xaml-wont-render-left-curly-bracket-in-button-cont.html), but it was closed and redirected here.
 
 **Problem description:**

 XAML designer won’t show left curly bracket if it’s defined with its decimal reference.

 **Actual behavior:**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51476918/81953685-4634ed80-9608-11ea-8b17-8959efc3260d.png)

 Building gives the following build error:
```
Error
MC3074
The tag '' does not exist in XML namespace https://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation'. Line 13 Position 17.
```

 **Expected behavior:**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51476918/81953853-754b5f00-9608-11ea-83ed-c9cf074c8803.png)

 **Minimal repro:**

```
<Window x:Class="Accolade_xaml_test.MainWindow"
        xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"
        xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
        xmlns:d="http://schemas.microsoft.com/expression/blend/2008"
        xmlns:mc="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/markup-compatibility/2006"
        xmlns:local="clr-namespace:Accolade_xaml_test"
        mc:Ignorable="d"
        Title="MainWindow" Height="450" Width="800">
    <WrapPanel>
        <Button Content="x" FontSize="40" Width="40"/>
        <Button Content="y" FontSize="40" Width="40"/>
        <Button Content="z" FontSize="40" Width="40"/>
        <Button Content="{" FontSize="40" Width="40"/> <!-- This should show left curly bracket { -->
        <Button Content="|" FontSize="40" Width="40"/>
        <Button Content="}" FontSize="40" Width="40"/>
        <Button Content="~" FontSize="40" Width="40"/>
    </WrapPanel>
</Window>
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "XAML won't render left curly bracket in button content" (#3000)

Issues.Title: Provide PopTransform for DrawingContext
Issues.Body: The `DrawingContext` could provide the method `PopTransform` in addition to `Pop` method, allowing to pop the last transform.

Issues.Title: Survey: repo contribution experience
Issues.Body:
We’ve been working as a team, and community, for five years in the dotnet org on the .NET Core project. Many of the same GitHub handles have remained constant over that time, some are new, and others have come and gone. Thanks to everyone that has contributed! We normally focus on how to improve the product, but we’re turning our focus to improving the open source project. We’ve created a survey to better understand your individual experience of participating and contributing in this project.

We would appreciate your feedback so we can work to address shortcomings and missed opportunities. If you don’t supply contact details, then responses will be anonymous.

[Survey](https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/ZLPVNX9?SourceRepo=dotnet%2Fwpf)

Thank you for your time!

### Discussion

For discussion, please go to https://github.com/dotnet/runtime/issues/36235.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Survey: repo contribution experience" (#2979)
